intro: Tovomita pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered tovomita, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Tovomita pauciflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
